00009 bool MMLmo::madedict = false;
00010 map<DOMString, MMLAttribute **> MMLmo::dict;

00012 MMLmo::MMLmo(MMLDocument *o)
00013         : MMLElement(MML::MO, o) {
00014         if (!madedict) {
00015                 makedict();
00016         }
00017         swidth = sascent = sdescent = 0;
00018         // initialize the default values for the attributes
00019         if (!defset[id]) {
00020                 defset[id] = true;
00021                 MMLAttribute **da = defatt[id];
00022                 using namespace MML;
00023                 createAttribute(MATHVARIANT, "normal", id, da);
00024                 createAttribute(FENCE, "false", id, da);
00025                 createAttribute(SEPARATOR, "false", id, da);
00026                 createAttribute(LSPACE, "thickmathspace", id, da);
00027                 createAttribute(RSPACE, "thickmathspace", id, da);
00028                 createAttribute(STRETCHY, "false", id, da);
00029                 createAttribute(SYMMETRIC, "false", id, da);
00030                 // set 1000 instead of infinity for now
00031                 createAttribute(MAXSIZE, "1000", id, da);
00032                 createAttribute(MINSIZE, "1", id, da);
00033                 createAttribute(LARGEOP, "false", id, da);
00034                 createAttribute(MOVABLELIMITS, "false", id, da);
00035                 createAttribute(ACCENT, "false", id, da);
00036         }
00037 }
00038 bool
00039 MMLmo::validate() {
00040         if (validated) {
00041                 return valid;
00042         } 
00043         valid = true;
00044         // an mo element may only contain MMLtext elements
00045         list<MMLNode *>::const_iterator n = child.begin();
00046         for (n=child.begin(); valid && n != child.end(); ++n) {
00047                 valid &= (*n)->isText();
00048                 if (!valid) {
00049                         errmsg = "An mo element may contain only text and no elements.";
00050                 }
00051         }
00052         validated = true;
00053         return valid;
00054 }
00055 void
00056 MMLmo::lookupOperator(const DOMString &op) {
00057         map<DOMString, MMLAttribute **>::const_iterator i;
00058         i = dict.find(op);
00059         if (i != dict.end()) {
00060                 for (uint j=0; j<moNumAtts; ++j) {
00061                         if (!att[j]) {
00062                                 att[j] = i->second[j];
00063                         }
00064                 }
00065         }
00066 }
00067 void
00068 MMLmo::doLayout(MML::Attributes *a) const {
00069         if (child.size() == 0) {
00070                 width = ascent = descent = 0;
00071                 return;
00072         }
00073         // make sure that there's only one text node
00074         normalize();
00075         MMLText *n = static_cast<MMLText *>(*child.begin());
00076         // the value of 'form' is a bit complicated. we use 'infix' for now
00077         createAttribute(MML::FORM, "infix", id, att);
00078         // set the default attributes depending on the contents of the
00079         // element
00080         lookupOperator(n->data());
00081 
00082         r->setEnv(this);
00083 
00084         applyTokenAtts(r);
00085         // todo: process operator attributes
00086         n->layout(r);
00087         width = r->att->lspace().get(r)+n->getWidth()+r->att->rspace().get(r);
00088         ascent = n->getAscent();
00089         descent = n->getDescent();
00090 
00091         r->unsetEnv(this);
00092 }
00093 void
00094 MMLmo::doPaint(MML::Attributes *a, Attributes *) {
00095         int ty = 0;
00096         if (child.size() == 0) {
00097                 return;
00098         }
00099         r->setEnv(this);
00100 
00101         applyTokenAtts(r);
00102         MMLText *n = static_cast<MMLText *>(*child.begin());
00103         // todo: process other attributes than stretchy
00104         if (r->att->stretchy()) {
00105                 bool stretched;
00106                 if (sascent) {
00107                         float fact = float(sascent+1+sdescent)/getHeight();
00108                         cerr << "setstretchv: "<<fact<< endl;
00109                         stretched = r->setFontStretch(fact, true);
00110                 } else {
00111                         cerr << "setstretchh: "<<float(swidth)/width<< endl;
00112                         stretched = r->setFontStretch(float(swidth)/width,
00113                                 false);
00114                 }
00115                 n->layout(r);
00116                 ty = n->getAscent();
00117                 if (stretched) {
00118                         ty -= sascent;
00119                 } else {
00120                         ty = ascent;
00121                 }
00122         }
00123         r->translate(x+r->att->lspace().get(r), y+ty);
00124         n->paint(r, 0);
00125 
00126         r->unsetEnv(this);
00127 }
00128 // this function may only be called after calling layout
00129 // so that the attribute values are set
00130 bool
00131 MMLmo::isStretchy(MMLPainter *r) {
00132         bool stretchy;
00133         r->att->setAttributes(this);
00134         stretchy = r->att->stretchy();
00135         r->att->unsetAttributes(this);
00136         return stretchy;
00137 }
00138 void
00139 MMLmo::setHeight(int a, int d) {
00140         sascent = a;
00141         sdescent = d;
00142         swidth = 0;
00143 }
00144 void
00145 MMLmo::setWidth(int w) {
00146         swidth = w;
00147         sascent = 0;
00148         sdescent = 0;

00153 void
00154 MMLmo::makedict() {
00155         madedict = true;
00156         for (int i=0; i<351; ++i) {
00157                 const char *end;
00158                 const char *start = rawopdict[i];
00159                 const char *send = start+strlen(start);
00160                 end = strchr(start, ' ');
00161                 DOMString op;
00162                 for (const char *j=start; j!=end; ++j) {
00163                         op += *j;
00164                 }
00165                 MMLAttribute **a = new MMLAttribute*[moNumAtts];
00166                 for (uint j=0; j<moNumAtts; ++j) {
00167                         a[j] = 0;
00168                 }
00169                 while (*end != '\0') {
00170                         DOMString name;
00171                         start = end+1;
00172                         end = strchr(start, '=');
00173                         for (const char *j=start; j!=end; ++j) {
00174                                 name += *j;
00175                         }
00176                         start = end+1;
00177                         end = strchr(start, ' ');
00178                         if (!end) end = send;
00179                         DOMString value;
00180                         for (const char *j=start; j!=end; ++j) {
00181                                 value += *j;
00182                         }
00183                         setAttribute(op.ascii(), name.ascii(), value, a);
00184                 }
00185                 dict.insert(pair<DOMString, MMLAttribute **>(op, a));
00186                 DOMString uni = op;
00187                 uni.resolveEntities();
00188                 if (uni != op) {
00189 /*              ushort uni = 0;
00190                 if (op.left(1) == "&" && op.right(1) == ";") {
00191                         uni = MMLDict::resolveEntity(op.mid(1,op.length()-2));
00192                 }
00193                 if (uni) {*/
00194                         dict.insert(pair<DOMString, MMLAttribute **>(uni, a));
00195                 }
00196         }
00197 }
00198 /* this function sets an attribute in a dictionary entry */
00199 void
00200 MMLmo::setAttribute(const char *op, const char *name, const DOMString &v,
00201                 MMLAttribute **a) {
00202         int pos = createAttribute(name, v, MML::MO, a);
00203         if (pos == -1) {
00204                 cerr << "internal error in MMLmo::makedict: invalid attribute '"
00205                         << name << "', value invalid: '" << v.ascii()
00206                         << "' for operator '" << op << "'." << endl;
00207                 exit(1);
00208         }
00209 }
